issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Noticed that some responses are containing a 'euca:' prefix to some of the returned parameters. This has/can break clients (ie eucalobo) who's parsing mechanisms do not account for this. Opening this ticket for discussion. 
Thanks!
-M

comments.body:
The response should be formatted as per:

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-DescribeConversionTasks.html
Try for this if the fix is simple.
Responses are now formatted as per EC2.

Hi [~sjones],
Looks like the prefix is still in the conversion task response(s). Below is the response(s) output from a system built this afternoon from packages.

Release     : 0.0.1000.20140507gitfd164b1b.el6
It looks like commit fd164b1b356ec9687920af0f9569244f6b3ef738 should have these changes (e298a5ae9ab01c1d7c32b9a61c6eda34194c9fc6)?
 
Thanks!
-Matt


Import Instance:
{code}

[~mclark], the response may vary depending on the message content, please provide steps to reproduce the issue.

HI [~sjones], 
The above were responses to the follow euca2ools import requests:
euca-import-instance cirrosraw.img -b mattimport -z PARTI00 -f raw -t m1.small -a x86_64 -p Linux --show-empty-fields --debug
euca-import-volume cirrosraw.img -b mattimport -z PARTI00 -f raw --show-empty-fields --debug

These were both issued on the CLC machine using euca2ools ver:
# euca-version 
euca2ools 3.1.0-pre3-26-gd136d07 (Omega)
eucalyptus 4.0.0

Note that at this time the bucket used in the request (ie 'mattimport') has to exist/be created prior to the import request. 
I don't think the image/file will matter in this case as long as it exists on the client. The 'cirrosraw.img' used here is a 40mb 'hvm' image/file. 
Thanks!
-M
Verified that this works by testing with EucaLobo.
